question_content: A disinfectant spray bottle says it eliminates 90% of bacteria with each application. You apply the disinfectant once to a countertop in the shipping department and then apply the disinfectant again to the same countertop. If the bottle is correct, what percentage of the bacteria originally on the tabletop have been eliminated?

You work as a dental hygienist, seeing patients for 6 hours each workday. Each of your appointments with a patient takes the same amount of time. Currently, you see 9 patients per workday. How many more minutes would you be able to spend with each patient if you saw only 8 patients per workday, still seeing patients for 6 hours each workday and spending an equal amount of time with each patient?

  1. 1
  2. 2
  3. 3
  4. 5
  5. 813
You process paychecks for your company. Paydays are 2 weeks apart, on Fridays. The first payday in one month is on the 12th. The next payday is on the:

Paydays at your company are equally spaced through the year. The paydays for one month are marked with a P on the calendar below. What is the date of the first payday in the month following the one shown?

You coordinate volunteers for litter cleanup in local parks. Your spreadsheet lists drivers and the number of seat belts in each driver’s car. The spreadsheet calculates the number of drivers (D) and the total number of seat belts (S). You want to know the maximum number of volunteers, besides drivers, that can be transported to the park in a single trip given that each person must have a seat belt of their own. Which of the following formulas would give your result?

  1. S
  2. SD
  3. D+S
  4. D−S
  5. S−D
You planted 488 acres of corn last season. You sold all your corn: 8,120 bushels in August and 64,100 bushels in September. What is your yield per acre, rounded to the nearest bushel per acre?

You schedule production of communications chips. After the chips are produced, they go to the QC department, where each chip must pass a 2-hour test. Over the past year, 5.0% of the chips have failed this test. You wish to choose a batch size that will yield as close as possible to 1,000 good chips, on average. Which of the following is the best batch size?

You are making extra part kits for a game. The table below lists the number of each part needed per kit, as well as the number of each part that you have available.

Part Number in each kit Number available
People marker 6 287
6-sided die 3 143
Teleporter marker 7 341

You make as many kits as you can. With the parts remaining, you could make 1 more kit if you had:
answer_content: “1 more people marker and 1 more die.” is the correct answer.

choice.a: 1 more die and 1 more teleporter marker.

choice.b: 1 more teleporter marker and 1 more people marker.

question_content: You are a cook. You just got orders for 2 steaks at table 6, 4 steaks at table 7, and 4 steaks at table 11. How many steaks should you put on the grill?

A single batch of cleaning solution contains 34 cup of bleach. How many cups of bleach are in 5 batches of the cleaning solution?

  1. 320
  2. 1520
  3. 114
  4. 2
  5. 334
To order the right amount of flooring, you need to know the floor area of the living room shown below. What is that area, in square feet?
Supplies for last year cost $1,477, which was $177 over budget. Rounded to the nearest 1%, by what percent did the cost exceed the budgeted cost?
A recipe requires 1.5 kilograms of eggs. How much is this in pounds?
The tip jar contains $42.60. You share equally with 2 other sandwich makers. What is your share?
A customer buys a bag of dog food that costs $12.79 and pays the sales tax of $0.64. How much change is due back from a $20 bill?
You are trying to order 14 pound of saffron, but the ordering system wants a decimal. What should you type in?

The vegetable display automatically sprays a mist over the vegetables according to a repeating timer you set. How many minutes should you set the timer for in order to spray the vegetables 5 times each hour?

  1. 15
  2.  5
  3. 12
  4. 20
  5. 55
Last week, your delivery runs took 7 hours 12 minutes on Monday, 6 hours 46 minutes on Wednesday, and 6 hours 53 minutes on Friday. What was your average time for a delivery run?
answer_content: “6 hours 57 minutes” is the correct answer.

question_content: Your business borrowed 10 bitcoins on May 1, when 1 bitcoin was worth $1,418.86. On June 1, 1 bitcoin was worth $2,441.29. Not counting the 1 month of interest, what is the total amount, including the principal, your business owed on June 1, in dollars?

Your company makes game parts using 3-D printers. One customer wants a circular game coin that is 2.0 centimeters across and 0.5 centimeters thick, as shown below. You need to estimate the amount of plastic you will need for each batch of 50 coins. How many cubic centimeters is that, rounded up if necessary to be a multiple of 10 cubic centimeters?

When a customer wants pie for dessert, you cut whole pies into 7 equal slices. At the end of your shift, 37 of a cherry pie, 27 of an apple pie, 37 of a peach pie, and 57 of a blueberry pie remain. How much pie remains, as a fraction of a whole pie?

  1. 137
  2. 1328
  3. 907
  4. 9028
  5. 902,401

You are checking the results of a phone app that counts calories. When someone eats, it is recorded as positive calories. When someone exercises, it is recorded as negative calories. What is the number of net calories for a person with the following record?

Description Calories

Bike, 30 min

−270

Breakfast

 560

Lunch

 770

Walk, 45 min

 −80

Dinner

 990

Tennis, 30 min

−130

The company warehouse contains 100 pallets of office paper, 25 pallets of photo paper, and 50 pallets of card stock. Each pallet of office paper is valued at $96, each pallet of photo paper is valued at $180, and each pallet of card stock is valued at $110.

Your partner is calculating the inventory value of these papers but thinks there is an error. Where in the calculations below is the error?

Step Description Result
1 Multiply 100 by $96 $ 9,600
2 Multiply 25 by $180 $ 4,500
3 Add $13,100
4 Multiply 50 by $110 $ 5,500
5 Add $18,600

You are writing up plans for building a table from a 4-foot-by-8-foot rectangular sheet of plywood. The table top will be a square, and the top face must be sanded. Which of the following is closest to the side length, in feet, of the largest square you can cut from the sheet of plywood?

The cafe where you work just ran out of coffee, and you are at the store to buy 112 pounds of coffee. You have put a can with 34 pound of coffee into your shopping cart. How many more pounds of coffee do you need?

  1. 12
  2. 32
  3. 34
  4. 36
  5. 214

You provide a dog-walking service, and you report to the owners on the amount of exercise their dogs get on the walks. You walked Fifi for 35 minutes and went 1.5 miles. What speed can you report to the owner?

  1. 78 mph
  2. 3560 mph
  3. 5360 mph
  4. 247 mph
  5. 278 mph

You need to buy at least 100 shirts to give away to the first 100 customers who buy a car at the dealership where you work. ShirtWorks charges $5.95 per shirt. OffMyBack’s prices are given in the table below. What is the least cost to get the shirts you need?

Number of shirts ordered Price per shirt for each shirt ordered
20 or less $7.25
21–50 $6.20
51–100 $5.90
101 or more $5.75

You can upgrade lighting at your factory to LED bulbs that cost $6.95 each and last an average of 5 years. It costs $3 in labor to change a bulb. Over a 10-year period, about how much will it cost per year to install LED bulbs in 100 lamps and change the bulbs when they burn out?

The type of part being manufactured today should be 1.27 inches wide, with a tolerance of 0.04 inches. If a part does not meet the size requirement, it must be rejected. You have 4 parts to inspect. They have the following widths. How many must be rejected?

1.275 inches, 1.300 inches, 1.266 inches, 1.255 inches

Your company has offices in 2 cities. The Denver office has 137 employees with an average salary of $67,013. The Anchorage office has 25 employees with an average salary of $71,332. To the nearest dollar, what is the average employee salary across your company?

Your marketing agency wants to send a survey to 500 people. You desire the respondents to represent the full range of incomes under $100,000 per year. You are authorized to purchase 500 names chosen at random from 1 of the following 3 databases. Which database is most likely to fit your needs, and why?

Income distribution

 Database 1 Database 2 Database 3

Mean

 $25,625 $49,205 $88,340

Standard deviation

 $15,990 $25,485 $35,870
answer_content: “Database 2, because its mean is centered between $0 and $100,000” is the correct answer.

choice.a: Database 1, because its standard deviation is smallest and so the data are most focused

choice.b: Database 2, because its mean is centered between $0 and $100,000

choice.c: Database 3, because its mean is closest to $100,000

choice.d: Database 3, because its standard deviation is largest

question_content:
You work in the mayor’s office and you are providing the mayor with a list of talking points for a speech. In your town, 13 of the residents live in rented dwellings. Of those who live in rented dwellings, 12 are in families with school-age children. On your list of talking points, what fraction of the residents should you list as living both in rented dwellings and in families with school-age children?

  1. 13
  2. 15
  3. 16
  4. 25
  5. 56

Your company takes orders over the phone. The company’s average call time is 4.6 minutes. The graph below shows 4 calls and the difference between the call time and the company’s average call time. For these 4 calls, what is the mean difference between the call times and the company’s average call time, rounded to the nearest 0.1 minute?

(Note: A negative difference indicates the call is shorter than the average.)

Customers at your store select their groceries from shelves and then pay. Sales records and records of restocks for Flaming Roast Coffee (1 lb size) are as follows:

Number of bags Tue Wed Thu Fri Sat Sun Mon
Sales  5  8  2 19 22 15  3
Restock  6 12 12 18 24  0  0

What is the net change in how many bags are on the shelf, from the beginning of Tuesday to the end of Monday?

(Note: A negative number indicates a decrease.)

A painting crew reported that a job is 35 completed. What fraction of the job remains to be done?

  1. 23
  2. 53
  3. 15
  4. 25
  5. 55

The tabletop below is made from right triangles, each the same size. Your company charges $0.20 per square inch for sanding the tabletop. Which of the following is closest to the tabletop’s area, in square inches?

Drainage tubing comes in large rolls. At your hardware store, you cut tubing to the lengths the customers want. You also provide customers with the volume of their tubing because they need to fill tubing with gravel as they install it. The tubing’s inside radius is 2 inches. Which of the following is an expression for the volume of L feet of drainage tubing, in cubic feet?

You are writing a book about a 3,030-mile bike race across the United States. You wonder about a title, and how many pedal strokes it takes to finish the race. Assuming a pedal stroke is about 16 feet on average, which of the following would be the best book title?
answer_content: “One Million Pedal Strokes” is the correct answer.

question_content: You and a partner tend 3 machines that run continuously. One prints 200 plastic bottles per hour, one prints 180 plastic bottles per hour, and one prints 150 plastic bottles per hour. If the machines work at their average rates, how many plastic bottles will they print during the 8.5 hours you are at the factory for your shift?

It takes about 14 person-hours of labor to break up a driveway and clear away the rubble. It takes about 8 person-hours of labor to pour and smooth concrete for the new driveway. About how many person-hours of labor does it take to break up a driveway, clear away the rubble, pour the concrete, and smooth the concrete?
You worked the dinner shift tonight and served a family their dinner. The bill was $43.89. They left $50 to pay for the meal; the remainder was your tip. How much was your tip?

You estimate that you have completed 14 of the work your boss expects this week. What percent of your work is complete?

  1.  14%
  2.  1.4%
  3.  4%
  4. 14%
  5. 25%
The 4 people in your crew each spent 4 hours laying sod. How many person-hours is this?

Your lab develops a synthetic compound that is extremely light but very durable. You test it by making a solid ball with a radius of 20.0 millimeters. Which of the following is closest to the volume of the synthetic compound ball, in cubic millimeters?

A basement bedroom must have a window with an opening area of at least 5.7 square feet, per the International Residential Code. A rectangular basement bedroom window opening is 0.75 meters wide. Among the following heights, in meters, which is the smallest that will qualify the window opening per the Code?

You are checking the intermediate results of a phone app that calculates the weight of an object in kilograms given the weight in pounds. The particular calculation you are checking, shown below, is for an input weight of 142 pounds and outputs 29.3 kilograms. What is the first step that has an error, and why is it an error?

Step 1

Input value: 142
Step 2

Conversion factor: 2.2
Step 3

Conversion result: 64.5
Step 4

Conversion factor: 2.2
Step 5

Conversion result: 29.3
answer_content: “Step 4, because there is only 1 conversion needed.” is the correct answer.

choice.a: Step 2, because the conversion factor should be 1,000.

choice.b: Step 3, because this conversion should have been multiplied by 2.2 instead of divided by 2.2.

choice.c: Step 4, because there is only 1 conversion needed.

choice.d: Step 5, because this conversion should have been multiplied by 2.2 instead of divided by 2.2.

question_content: You’ve just finished making 3 batches of plastic tumblers: a red batch, a yellow batch, and a purple batch. There are 500 tumblers in each batch. You are now making sets of 3 tumblers that contain 1 tumbler of each color. How many sets can you make?

You just found out that the balance in one of the company’s bank accounts dropped below $0 to –$425.59. Now you must adjust the balance to include the $30 penalty that the bank will charge, and then transfer funds from another of the company’s accounts. What is the balance after the penalty and before you transfer any funds?

You give tours on the Great Lakes and talk about points of interest. A lighthouse typically has 2 beacons that rotate together—but not necessarily facing opposite directions. In that way, it can be a shorter time between the first and second flashes than between the second flash and the third flash (when the first beacon comes around for the second time). One way of identifying which lighthouse you are looking at is to find the ratio of the short time between flashes to the long time between flashes. If the beacons are set 120° apart along the rotation, as shown below, what is this ratio?

You are analyzing the survey results tabulated below. The first survey question (yes/no) is whether the respondent is over 40, and the second survey question (low-cal, regular) is whether the respondent prefers low-cal butter or the regular.

Number of responses low-cal regular
yes 47 59
no 32 44

What is the ratio of those who prefer the low-cal to those who prefer the regular?

A customer wants you to enlarge a photo to 234 its current height. The photo’s current height is 314 inches. What should its enlarged height be, in inches?

  1. 6
  2. 6316
  3. 61116
  4. 7
  5. 81516

You have $28, and you want to get half-dollar coins from the bank to give to children who come into your store. How many half-dollar coins are in $28?

  1. 14
  2. 28
  3. 2812
  4. 42
  5. 56
Your last doctor’s visit cost $105. Health insurance through your employer paid $84, and you paid the remaining $21. What percentage of the cost did you pay?
answer_content: “20%” is the correct answer because 21/105 x 100 = 20%.

question_content:
You need to buy 30 pounds of hamburger and 15 packages of buns for a staff-appreciation picnic. You have 2 options for hamburger and 2 options for buns, shown below. In addition, you have a 10%-off coupon that can be used on either the hamburger or the buns, but not both, after any other discounts are applied. What is your best cost, including tax of 5% of the purchase price after all discounts, rounded to the nearest $0.01?

Hamburger Original price per pound Sale
Coco Farms $2.29
Open Acres $2.39 10% off original price
Buns Price per package
Burly Buns $1.93 5% off original price
Stone Bakery $1.80

You work summer construction, and your hours may vary depending on the weather. The following table provides the number of hours you worked each day for the past week. On average, how many hours did you work per day?

Sun. Mon. Tues. Wed. Thurs. Fri. Sat.
Hours 5.5 12 9.5 11 7 10 8

You need to purchase supplies for an employee appreciation picnic. Your boss gives you the shopping list below and asks that you get the best deal by buying from one grocer, either Quality Groceries or Fresh Market. You call both grocers, and they provide the price information that you put into the table. Which grocer will provide all these picnic supplies for the lowest cost, and what is that cost without sales tax?

Hamburger Patties 50
Hot Dogs 2 dozen
Hamburger Buns 50
Hot Dog Buns 2 dozen
Potato Salad 2 gallons
Ice Cream 5 gallons
Product Quality Groceries Unit Quality Groceries Price per Unit Fresh Market Unit Fresh Market Price per Unit
Hamburger Patties Package of 10 $15.50 Package of 8 $12.40
Hot Dogs Package of 12 $6.23 Package of 10 $4.99
Hamburger Buns Package of 8 $3.79 Package of 8 $3.55
Hot Dog Buns Package of 12 $2.75 Package of 8 $2.55
Potato Salad Gallon $4.33 Gallon $5.55
Ice Cream Gallon $7.55 Gallon $6.99

You are putting 30 different bolts into bins according to the size of the bolt. So far, you have successfully put 10 bolts into bins, which is 13 of the total job. What is your answer when your supervisor asks, “Within 1%, what percent of the job is complete?”

  1. 13%
  2. 10%
  3. 30%
  4. 33%
  5. 50%

Your company will replace the asphalt roofs on all the buildings at the factory complex shown below. The buildings have flat roofs. You charge according to the total roof area. What is this area, in square yards?

The label on a ceiling lighting fixture warns you to use a lightbulb of 60 watts or less. The voltage to the lightbulb is 120 volts. An intern calculated how much amperage a bulb of the maximum allowed wattage will draw. You are checking her work, shown below. If there is an error, what is the first step that has an error, and why is it an error?

Step 1 volts × amps = watts write down formula
Step 2 120 × ? = 60 fill in what is known
Step 3

It looks like 0.5 will work

120 × 0.5 = 60

 check
Step 4 amps = 0.5
answer_content: “There is no error.” is the correct answer.

choice.a: Step 2, because the question mark should be by itself on the right side of the equation.

choice.b: Step 3, because you can’t just guess at a solution.

choice.c: Step 4, because the answer in the previous step was 60.

question_content: You work in a chemical lab. Last quarter, you successfully completed an average of about 5 chemical analyses per day. This quarter, you have increased this average to about 8 per day. What is your percent increase?

You work for the city recreation department, which is hosting a 5 kilometer run/walk next week. Your coworker measured the course and found that it is only 4.75 kilometers long. He asks you to move the finish line forward 0.25 kilometers. Your tape measure is marked in feet and inches. What is the distance he has asked you to move the finish line, to the nearest foot?

You are making extra part kits for a game. The table below lists the number of each part needed per kit, as well as the number of each part that you have available.

Part Number in each kit Number available
People marker 6 287
6-sided die 3 143
Teleporter marker 7 341

You make as many kits as you can. With the parts remaining, you could make 1 more kit if you had:
answer_content: “1 more people marker and 1 more die.” is the correct answer.

choice.a: 1 more die and 1 more teleporter marker.

choice.b: 1 more teleporter marker and 1 more people marker.

question_content: To order the right amount of flooring, you need to know the floor area of the living room shown below. What is that area, in square feet?
answer_content: “180” is the correct answer.

question_content:
You need to purchase supplies for an employee appreciation picnic. Your boss gives you the shopping list below and asks that you get the best deal by buying from one grocer, either Quality Groceries or Fresh Market. You call both grocers, and they provide the price information that you put into in the table. Which grocer will provide all these picnic supplies for the lowest cost, and what is that cost without sales tax?

Hamburger Patties 50
Hot Dogs 2 dozen
Hamburger Buns 50
Hot Dog Buns 2 dozen
Potato Salad 2 gallons
Ice Cream 5 gallons
Product Quality Groceries Unit Quality Groceries Price per Unit Fresh Market Unit Fresh Market Price per Unit
Hamburger Patties Package of 10 $15.50 Package of 8 $12.40
Hot Dogs Package of 12 $6.23 Package of 10 $4.99
Hamburger Buns Package of 8 $3.79 Package of 8 $3.55
Hot Dog Buns Package of 12 $2.75 Package of 8 $2.55
Potato Salad Gallon $4.33 Gallon $5.55
Ice Cream Gallon $7.55 Gallon $6.99
answer_content: “Quality Groceries, $168.40” is the correct answer.

question_content:
You report to your supervisor the average length of chain produced per operating hour each week. The equipment operates 5 days a week for 12 hours each day. According to last week’s production numbers shown in the table, how many feet of chain were produced per operating hour?

DAY Monday Tuesday Wednesday Thursday Friday
Feet of Chain 862 905 792 825 816
answer_content: “70” is the correct answer.

question_content: Q. You are stocking inventory in a retail store and want to determine the number of suit jackets on a hanger. There are six (6) navy suit jackets sizes M through XL, and seven (7) gray suit jackets sizes XS through XL. How many suit jackets are there in total?

Q. You are picking up lumber at a lumber yard for a construction project. In addition to the ten (10) boards you already have, you purchase thirty-five (35) more and receive two (2) extras for customer loyalty. How many boards do you have after the purchase? Type your answer in the box.
Q. You are driving to a conference in Cleveland and have already traveled 100 miles. You still have 50 more miles to go. When you arrive in Cleveland, how many miles will you have driven?
Q. You’re in charge of filling out the office supply purchase orders for your company. If you need 20,000 sheets of paper, and one ream of paper equals 500 sheets, where will you get the best deal?

Q. One of your employees is bidding on a carpet installation job. They estimate that it will take 3 hours to install 12 square yards of carpeting in a room that measures 11' 6" by 12' 9" and that it will take 12.3 hours to install the carpet. Is the bid correct? If not, what error was made?

choice.a: No, the bid is about 3 times too high. The square yards may have not been converted to square feet.

choice.b: No, the bid is off by 4 hours.

choice.c: No, the bid is almost 10 times too high.

question_content: Q. You’re ordering more thread for Blue Jeans Co. You usually purchase from Ted’s Threads, which sells 12 thread spools for $27. You recently received a notice from Wade's Wares that says you can buy thread from them for $2.30 each for the first 2 dozen and $2 a spool thereafter. You need to order 5 dozen spools. What percentage can you save by going with Wade’s Wares?

Q. Saline IV fluid bags cost $64.20 for twenty-four 1,000 ml bags from one supplier. A new supplier sells 500 ml bags for $2 each. The hospital uses about ten thousand 1,000 ml bags each month. Nurses report that about half of the bags are more than half full when they are discarded. If you are going to use only one supplier, which size bag provides the best deal, and how much will you save each month? Compare the cost of the new supplier to the current one.

You are arranging a long weekend retreat for your company's executives. You choose two different ski resorts to find the best deal for ski lessons. The executives would like to have 2 hours of ski lessons on both Friday and Saturday.

Q. Super Ski charges $378 for 3 days of 2-hour lessons. Monster Ski offers lessons for $75 an hour. Super Ski is 10 miles from the hotel, and Monster Ski is 15 miles. It will cost $0.43 per mile to drive to the lessons. Which resort is the better deal for the company?

choice.b: They both give the same deal

question_content: Q. On a recent business trip, a salesman traveled 52 miles the first hour, 64 miles the second hour, and 49 miles the third hour. How many miles did he average per hour? Type your answer in the box. _____ miles per hour.
answer_content: Solution: The correct answer is 55 miles per hour.

question_content: Q. What is the average number of receipts per quarter at Kingpin Parts?

Q. A human resource manager is researching the entry-level salary for a technician position. He determines that other companies in the area are paying $15.50, $16.85, $14.25 and $15.95 per hour. What is the average pay for an entry-level technician position?

Q. Sales Team A at Drive-A-Lot Cars sells nine (9) cars during the first week of the new sales period. Over the next three weeks, they sell six (6) cars, ten (10) cars and seven (7) cars. What is the team’s average weekly sales for the four weeks?

Q. Drive-A-Lot Cars runs a promotion for three years of interest-free payments on sedans. The cost of a new sedan is $22,968 (including tax). What is the average monthly payment a customer will make if they pay off the car during the interest-free period? Type your answer in the box. $ _____
Q. Your company sells $25,543 worth of merchandise in January, $15,550 in February, and $32,461 in March. What are the average sales for these months?
Q. During one particular sales day, 75% of the store's customers paid with credit cards. If there were 60 customers that day, how many used a credit card?
Q. After several shares of the company's stock were sold, a profit of $1,320 was earned. The profit was 15% over a 30-day period. How much were the shares worth when they were originally purchased?

Q. You’re working at a theater where you are evaluating attendance at several events. From the first event to the second event, attendance dropped from 250 to 230. Find the percent decrease to the nearest percent.

Q. You sell a smartphone that was originally priced at $600 but is now on sale for 20% off. You give a customer with a loyalty card an additional 10% discount. What is the total percent of discount the customer receives on the purchase?

Q. You select several items from a supply catalog. The list prices of the items are $4.29, $2.13, $1.25, $17.95 and $0.85. Your company gets a 10% discount on all items in the catalog. How much should you make out a purchase order for, including the undiscounted $10 shipping charge and 5.25% sales tax?

Q. You’re assisting a craft vendor at a fair who sells 5 knit hats for $9.50 each. She then sells the sixth and seventh for $11.25 each, and the eighth and ninth for $8.75 each. At the end of the fair, she is charged 15% of her gross earnings for the booth space. How much money does she make after paying for the booth space?

Q. The table shows how a leading automobile dealer plans to spend its advertising dollars for this year. If this company plans to increase its budget by 5% next year, approximately how much will it spend on social media ads?
Q. Your company has decided to give 15% of all weekend sales to a community charity. If the total weekend sales are $9,520, your company will give $635.

Q. You’re in charge of evening entertainment for an important client group. You use the company credit card to take their four representatives out to dinner. Two (2) people order the steak entrée for $32.50. Two (2) people order the grilled tuna for $28.90, and you order the lasagna for $24.95. When the bill comes, you tip 20%. What is the amount of tip you leave? $ _____
Q. A quality report for a production line shows a score of 59 points on a 65-point inspection test. A passing score is 95% compliance. Did the production line pass inspection?
Q. A machinist is allowed 1% tolerance on a shaft that measures 15 inches long. What is the amount of tolerance?
Q. You’re working in the sedan section of Dean’s Car Dealership. A customer makes a down payment of 15% on a new car that costs $13,450. How much is the down payment?
Q. You work in a department store and sell a dress that is on sale for $58.80. If the regular price of the dress is $98, what is the discount?
Q. The combined sales tax rate for your county is 7.25%. How much would you pay to purchase a new video game system with a listed price of $299?
Q. As purchasing assistant at Rosie’s Retail, you order a unique item for $1,055. You mark it to sell for 117% of the purchasing cost. How much do you sell it for?

Q. Rates can be adjusted for different time periods. If you know how many parts can be made in an hour, then you can determine how many parts can be made in a matter of seconds and minutes, or even days and weeks.
Q. Your start-up company has invented a new water filter. If the filter can process 10 gallons of water per minute, how many gallons of water can it process in one 24-hour day?
Q. It takes 11 widgets to assemble one motor. Your team can assemble 4 motors in 1 day. If you need to order parts for next week, and each week is 5 working days, how many widgets should you order?
Q. A software coder can type 79 words per minute. She works 5 eight-hour days each week (not including breaks). How many words does she type in a week?
Q. Two pumps are used to empty a sewage tank. One pump pumps 60 gallons per minute (gpm) and the second pumps 50 gpm. They pumped for 30 minutes. How many total gallons were pumped?

Q. It takes 2.5 yards of material to make a dress. Harley's Clothing Design estimates that they can produce 48 dresses each week. If there are 52 weeks in a year, how much material will they need to purchase to make dresses for a year?

Q. An assembly line produces 2 toasters per minute. It is 2:00 pm and the line has finished 560 out of its goal of 900 for the day. The line stops at 5:00 pm. A coworker is urging you to stop the line for a half hour break, saying that you will make the goal anyway. Should you stop the line for a half hour break?

choice.a: You can’t tell from this information.

choice.b: No, you will be 40 short if you do.

question_content: Q. A circuit board manufacturer can produce 2,000 boards per hour. How many days will it take to produce 16,500 if the company has a 10-hour work shift?

Q. You work for a food wholesaler that provides ingredients for restaurants and other food producers. A large-scale bakery needs 72 pounds of raisins. The raisins come in 12-ounce boxes. A total of 24 boxes will fit in a case. How many cases of raisins should you ship to them?
Q. A piece of equipment moves 16.8 yards in 12 minutes. How many feet does it move per second?
Q. An assembly line produces 20 items per hour. If the line runs 24 hours per day, 7 days per week, how many items are made by this machine in one month? (Assume 30 days/month)
Q. One yard equals three feet. How many yards are there in 63 feet? Type your answer in the box. _____ Yards.
Q. There are 60 seconds in a minute. How many minutes are in 360 seconds?
Q. You work for a florist. Normally, it takes you 20 hours to assemble 10 flower arrangements. How long does it take you to assemble one flower arrangement?
Q. You are a truck driver for a distribution center. You drove 30 hours in 5 days. What is your average daily travel time?
Q. As the grounds maintenance manager, you need to replace the fence of a 30-foot-by-40-foot commercial lot. Which of the following shows the calculation for the perimeter of the lot?
Q. A glass company is to make a panel of glass for a front door. What is the area of the glass panel if it is 120 cm long and 20 cm wide?
Q. A builder needs to tile a 7-foot-by-8-foot room with one-foot square tiles. How many tiles will she need? Type your answer into the box. _____ tiles

Q. You need to rent meeting space in a downtown coworking center that charges $25/hour per room. If you want the largest room for your money, which room is a better deal? The Hub Room, measuring 9 feet by 11 feet, or the Huddle Room, measuring 8 feet by 12 feet, and by how much?

choice.a: The Huddle Room, by 3 sq feet.

choice.c: The Hub Room, by 11 sq feet.

question_content: Q. A carpet cleaner charges $0.70 per square foot to clean carpet. In the next house she is going to clean, the living room measures 18 feet by 24 feet. How much will she charge?
Q. You need to go from point A to point B and must walk along the side of the building. Which way is shorter?
Q. A contractor has been hired to install flooring in a concert hall in the shape of a circle that is 21 feet across. How many square feet of flooring will be required? Use 3.14 for π.

Q. A painter needs to paint a circular helicopter landing pad that is 24 yards in diameter. A gallon of paint covers 59 square yards. How many full gallons of paint are needed to cover the landing pad?
Q. An architect is designing a circular opening 16 feet in diameter to make room for a spiral staircase. If pi = 3.14, what will the circumference of the circular opening be?
Q. You’re manufacturing a border around a circular café table. The table is 36 inches across. How much border is needed for the project?
Q. A customer purchases three pairs of pants for $17.95, $18.32, and $20.98 (prices include tax). How much change should you give back if they paid with one $50 bill and one $20 bill?

Q. You are a carpenter and have a 3 16 inch piece of wood and a 5 16 inch piece of wood. If you glue the pieces together, what is the new measurement of the combined piece of wood in its lowest form? Type your answer in the box as a fraction in the simplest form. _____ inches
Q. A customer hands you three (3) five-dollar bills, five (5) quarters, and two (2) dimes to pay the full amount for an item. How much does the item cost?

Q. You manage inventory for Swim Chem, a large distributor of chemicals for indoor and outdoor pool companies. Your division sold 2.4 tons of chlorine on Monday, 4.4 on Tuesday, 1.8 on Wednesday, and 2.8 on Thursday. If last week’s sales totaled 14.4 tons, how much chlorine sold on Friday? Type your answer in the box below. _____ tons of chlorine
answer_content: Solution: The correct answer is 3 tons of chlorine.

question_content: Q. A part-time contractor at a manufacturing facility earns $11.00 per hour. He worked 4 1 4 hours on Tuesday, 3 1 4 hours on Wednesday, 7 1 4 hours on Thursday, and 5 1 4 hours on Friday. How much money did he earn for the week?

Q. While making deliveries for a courier service, you drive 0.75 miles. What fraction of a mile, in simplified form, have you driven?

  1. 1 4 mile
  2. 2 4 mile
  3. 75 100 mile
  4. 3 4 mile

Q. You’re packaging orders at Green Market Food Suppliers. Each crate holds four large bottles, one in each quadrant. Identify the mixed fraction, in simplified form, of filled crates in the drawing.

  1. 2 3
  2. 6 4
  3. 1 and 2 4
  4. 1 and 1 2

Q. To test the rate of stream water evaporation, you fill two 18-inch containers to the brim with stream water and leave them in protected areas in the shade. When you return one week later, Container A is 8 18 -inches full and Container B is 5 18 -inches full. How much less water, in the simplest form, is in Container B?

  1. 1 3 of an inch
  2. 1 6 of an inch
  3. 3 18 of an inch
  4. 12 18 of an inch

Q. Match the numbers and terms by selecting the correct number for each label.

Decimal

Fraction

Percentage
answer_content: Solution: The correct answers are Decimal = 0.5, Fraction = 1 2 and Percentage = 50%.

question_content:
Q. Change 0.25 to a fraction in simplest form.

  1. 25 100
  2. 1 4
  3. 1 3
  4. 1 2

Q. In the checkout line, a customer has two coupons for the same item. One is 1 3 off, and the other is 1 2 off. Which coupon will give the customer the biggest discount?

  1. 1 3
  2. 1 2

Q. You are a batter mixer in a factory that makes cakes. The batter calls for 0.75 of a teaspoon of almond extract. Your measuring spoons show fractions, not decimals. Using your tools to measure, how much almond extract should you add?

  1. 1 4 of a teaspoon
  2. 1 2 of a teaspoon
  3. 3 4 of a teaspoon
  4. 1 3 of a teaspoon

Q. There are two jobs you can apply for. The first job pays $22,000 the first year, with raises of $4,000 each year thereafter. The second job pays $26,000 the first year with raises of $2,000 each year thereafter. When would you make as much money in the first job as in the second?
Q. Power Company A sells electricity for $0.04/kWh. Company B sells for $0.03/kWh plus a $100/month charge. If your business uses 4,000 kWh per month, which company should you use?

choice.b: Both Company A and B cost the same.

question_content: Q. A printing business employs 35 people. The employer offers the employees an insurance package that costs the company $2,170. The employer has been investigating various plans. A new plan would cost $59 per employee plus a one-time $70 sign up fee (not per employee). Is the new plan a better deal?

Q. The manager is balancing the ledger for a small art supply store. The initial balance is $463.76. Customer refunds for $12.56, $52.11 and $26.03 have been given today and sales were $101.32 and $10.98. The manager comes up with a new balance of $511.39. What did the manager do wrong?

Q. A crew you’re supervising is installing a circular patio. In order to purchase the materials, they need to compute the area. The plans call for a diameter of 12 yards. The crew figures the area of the patio will be 37.68 square yards. Did the crew calculate the area correctly? If not, why?

choice.a: No, they forgot to multiply by pi (3.14).

choice.b: No, they used diameter instead of the radius.

question_content:
Q. As a self-employed seamstress, you know that it takes 7 yards of material to make 3 jackets. You bought 15 yards of material to make 7 jackets. Did you buy enough material? If not, how much were you over or under?

  1. Yes, you bought 2 yards more than you need.
  2. Yes, you bought just enough.
  3. No, you need 1 1 3 more yards.
  4. No, you need 1 more yard.
Q. At a recent sale, a stereo system was marked down to $1,550.25. The price tag claimed that this was a 75% discount from the original price of $2,067. Is the price tag correct? If not, why?

choice.a: No, the sale price shown is 75% of the original price, not a 75% discount.

choice.b: No, they added the discount instead of subtracting it.

choice.c: Yes, the tag shows the correct price.

question_content: Q. A repairman charges $18 per hour to repair appliances plus $0.27 per mile to drive to the house and back. It took the repairman 2 hours and 15 minutes to fix the Andersen's washing machine, and he drove 21 miles to get to their home. He charged $51.84 for the visit. Was the charge correct? If not, why?

choice.a: No, he converted minutes to hours incorrectly.

choice.b: Yes, the charge is correct as it is.

choice.c: No, he charged for the mileage twice.

question_content:
Q. As a review, recall the difference between perimeter, area, and volume by matching each definition with the word below.

Volume

Area

Perimeter
answer_content: Solution: The correct answers are: Volume = The amount a container can hold, Area = The space a flat shape covers, and Perimeter = The length around an object.

question_content: Q. You’re filling prescriptions in a pharmacy. Your work surface tray gives you an area of 432 square inches to work. If the length is 24 inches, what is the width of the tray? _____ inches

Q. You are laying out a new retail store and need to arrange some displays. You know that the store is 8,800 square feet in size, and that it is 110 feet wide. How deep (from front to back) is the store? _____ feet
Q. You are carpeting a boardroom which measures 16 feet by 14.5 feet with a carpet that costs $18.50 per square foot of finished space. How much will the carpet flooring cost?

Q. A chemical company is applying a layer of paint to the lids of cylindrical storage tanks, and needs to determine the area of the lids in order to buy the correct amount of paint. If the diameter of one cylinder lid is 2 feet, what is the area of the lid?

Q. You’re repairing a large rectangular aquarium. The final step is to cover the glass with a protective film. The front and back of the aquarium measure 4 meters by 2 meters, and the sides of the aquarium measure 3 meters by 2 meters. How many square meters of protective film do you need?
Q. Which has the greater surface area: a 6-centimeter cube or a rectangular prism with a 3-centimeter square base and a height of 12 centimeters?

Q. You’re on a residential construction team doing roofing. The pitch of a roof is 1 3 rise over run. Find the rise if the horizontal run of the roof is 15 feet 3 4 inches.

  1. 5 feet 1 4 inch
  2. 47 feet 1 4 inch
  3. 5 feet 3 4 inch
  4. 47 feet 3 4 inch
Q. Fine Floors can install 15 square yards of carpeting in 4 hours 30 minutes. At this rate, how long would it take to install carpeting in a room that measures 11 feet 9 inches by 13 feet 4 inches?

Q. Your computer server recently crashed, and you need to make changes to a large manual. The manual contains approximately 16,000 words. A clerk types 4,160 words in 1 hour 20 minutes. The salary and benefits for the clerk cost the firm approximately $17.65/hour. How much will recreating the manual cost the firm?

Q. It takes 830 bricks to construct a wall that measures 14 feet 9 inches long and 6 feet high. The crew you hire can lay 300 bricks/hour. The cost of the labor is $4,000 per eight-hour workday and you can pay for a partial day. You need to build a wall 36' 6" long and 6' high. How much will the new wall cost?

Q. As a part-time contractor, you want to test a new cement mixture for a project. You need 2 3 4 wheelbarrows of sand to make 8 wheelbarrows of concrete. How much sand will you need to make 248 cubic feet of concrete?

  1. 85 1 4 cubic feet
  2. 682 cubic feet
  3. 140 1 2 cubic feet
  4. Not enough information.

Q. You’re working in a pharmacy, and are making a table to help with dosage amounts for a certain drug. The recommended dosage is 40 milligrams per 2.2 pounds of body weight, divided into three daily doses and taken every 8 hours. You want entries for children weighing 10 pounds, 15 pounds, and 30 pounds. The drug comes in a 200 mg/5 ml formula. If 1 teaspoon = 5 ml, how many teaspoons are required for each entry? Round your answer to the nearest 1 4 teaspoon.

  1. 1, 1 1 2 , 2 3 4
  2. 181, 272, 545.5
  3. 10, 15, 30
  4. 4.5, 7, 13

The following are daily outputs from shift A and shift B at a factory.

  • Shift A: {77, 91, 82, 68, 75, 72, 85, 65, 70, 79, 94, 86}
  • Shift B: {68, 93, 53, 100, 77, 86, 91, 88, 72, 74, 66, 82}

Q. Compare the means of the shift outputs. The workers in the shift with the highest mean will earn a bonus. Which shift will earn the bonus?

The following are daily customer numbers at an outerwear store. You’ve calculated the median number of customers for the first six days of the week:

Q. If the store has 173 visitors on Sunday, will the median increase, decrease, or stay the same?

Q. Alex is managing an assembly line creating precision drill bits. The number of drill bits created is in the chart above. What is the mode number of drill bits created?

_____ bits

The following is a list of health and sanitation scores for individual restaurants in a restaurant chain.

{92.4, 93.6, 97, 96.5, 98.2, 91.5, 93.7, 99, 99.5, 94.2, 95.8}

Q. Any score below 91 is unacceptable, but management would also like to know the range of the scores. A range of 7.5 or below is acceptable to management, but any range above 7.5 is unacceptable and will trigger a re-evaluation of the company’s sanitation training procedures. Is the range acceptable or unacceptable?

Q. Lucy works for a company that manufactures liquid dyes for fabric. She currently wants to mix up some 23%-concentrated teal dye. She has 16 gallons of 15%-concentrated teal dye, as well as plenty of 25%-concentrated teal dye. How many gallons of the 25%-concentrated teal dye will Lucy need to add to the 15%-concentrated teal dye to make a batch with a concentration of 23%?

_____ gallons

Q. An online seed supplier packages a seed mix that costs the company $20.70 per pound. The mix includes poppy seeds costing $24.00 per pound and clover seeds costing $13.00 per pound. If a worker is going to prepare some of this mix and has already measured out 26 pounds of poppy seeds, how many pounds of clover seeds should he add?

A food processing plant is packaging 32 oz. bags of coffee beans. The tolerance is 0.25 ounces. A total of 100 bags of coffee were weighed, and the number at each weight is shown in the table below:

Q. If more than 1 in 10 bags is outside of the acceptable tolerance, the bagging line is paused until the problem is identified. Does the line need to be paused?

choice.b: There’s not enough information to know.

question_content:
Q. An assembly line is manufacturing gears that have a circumference of 8 cm. The tolerance for the circumference of the gears is 0.03 cm. To check the quality of the gears, the foreman has pulled 19 off the line and measured their circumferences. What percentage of the gears fall outside of the tolerance? Round your answer up to the nearest percentage. {7.96, 7.965, 7.97, 7.982, 7.99, 7.99, 8, 8, 8, 8, 8, 8, 8.01, 8.01, 8.012, 8.02, 8.025, 8.029, 8.031}

_____ %

You’re working in the product development department of a large toy manufacturer. The two grids you’re working with will be laser cut and inserted into an interactive shapes game for toddlers. The dots on the grid are 1 inch apart.

Q. Find the total area for the two shapes in order to determine how much raw material will be cut away from the surface. Type the correct answer in the box. _____ sq in

Q. You’ve been tasked with adding soundproofing panels to 10 private offices. Each office is 12 feet by 16 feet with 8-foot ceilings. Paneling sheets are 4 feet by 8 feet, and are only applied to the walls, not the ceiling. Assume that each office has 4 walls. How many panels are required for all the offices?

Q. You’ve been contracted to wallpaper a wall 10 feet wide and 12 feet high with a square window with 3-foot sides. How many square feet of wallpaper do you need to cover the wall if you exclude the opening for the window? _____ square feet
answer_content: Solution: The correct answer is 111 square feet.

question_content: Q. To assess the surface space of the glass panel on the front of a new handheld device your engineering team is building, find the area of the shape shown.
Q. A ceiling measures 24 feet by 26 feet. You need to install ceiling tiles measuring 2 feet by 4 feet in size. How many ceiling tiles are required?

Q. The company you’re interning at stores liquid in cylinder-shaped tanks, the smallest of which are 10 feet in diameter and 30 feet high. How much liquid can a small tank hold if filled completely full?
Q. To store paint, a factory has purchased a cylindrical tank that is 6 feet across and 9 feet deep. What is the maximum number of cubic feet of paint the tank will hold?

Q. You’re working for a tourism company that provides travelers with a unique “View from Above” hot air balloon tour. If you have a round hot air balloon that is shaped like a ball and is 50 feet in diameter, how much air does it contain? Use 3.14 for π.
Q. A professional chef has a cone-shaped strainer with a diameter of 6 inches and a height of 10 inches. If the chef can fill it to the top with rice, how many cubic inches will the cone hold?

Q. A large conical mound of sand with a diameter of 45 feet and height of 15 feet is being stored as a key raw ingredient for products at your glass manufacturing company. What is the approximate volume of the mound?

Q. You’re working at a concrete company that specializes in commercial-grade columns. A cylindrical column with a diameter of 3 feet and height of 10 feet is to be made of concrete. How many cubic yards of concrete are needed to fabricate the column?

Q. A cylindrical bin with a diameter of 15 feet 3 inches and a height of 24 feet 4 inches is used to hold wheat on the farm where you’re interning. One cubic foot holds 0.804 bushels. About how many bushels of wheat can be stored?

Q. You are working on an air conditioning system. A roll of cylindrical copper tubing has an outside diameter of 78 inch and an inside diameter of 34 inch. How much refrigerant can 12 feet of the tubing hold?

Q. You used an app to hire a repair worker to do a series of small repairs around your office. The worker charges $54 for the first hour, and $15.50 for each additional 15 minutes. If the worker charged you $162.50, how long did the repairs take?

Q. A customer wants to re-carpet a living room and hallway. You charge $5.99 per square yard to remove old carpet and $4.50 per square yard to install the new carpet. The carpet and pad they selected are $16.99 and $3.00 per square yard, respectively. The living room is 17 1 2 by 20 feet and the hall is 4 by 12 feet. About how much should you charge for this job?
Q. One yard = three feet. A carpenter has a piece of wood that is 10 yards long. How many feet of wood does the carpenter have? _____ ft
Q. It takes 4 minutes to complete an administrative task. There are 60 seconds in 1 minute. How many seconds does it take to complete the same task?
Q. You have 7 people in your work group. If you each worked 38 hours during last week, how many total hours were worked by the group? _____ hours
Q. A bread machine produces 159 loaves of bread per hour. The machine operates 10 hours per day. How many loaves of bread does it produce per day? _____ loaves
Q. Your employer pays you 1 1 2 times your normal wage on holidays. If your normal hourly wage is $12/hour, how much will you make per hour on the holiday?
Q. You have 50 rolls of fencing that are each 15 1 2 feet long. What is the total length of fencing? _____ feet
Q. As a project manager, you need to plan production runs over the next 3 1 2 weeks. If your team is able to produce 1,250 widgets in one week, how many widgets can they produce in 3 1 2 weeks?

Q. One of your clients at Wills, Trusts & Estates Law, PLLC passes away. His estate is worth $72,000. He leaves half to charity, and 18 to each of his four children. How much will each child receive? $ _____
Q. An operator in the plant receives a monthly salary. His rent, which is $849, is exactly 1 3 of his pay. What is his total pay per month? $ _____

Q. You’re laying plumbing on a construction site. The blueprints call for 8 sections of 53 4-inch-long piping. How many inches of piping will you use?

  1. 9
  2. 121 2
  3. 40
  4. 46

Q. You work in a science lab where it is critical to keep samples at specific temperatures. You check the temperature in a refrigerator, and it registers -10 degrees C. Your supervisor states that the temperature should be 15 degrees C colder (further below zero degrees). At what temperature should you set the refrigerator? _____ °C

Q. You work on a manufacturing line. Currently, the status board for the line says “−55.” This means that your line still needs to produce 55 items to meet the day’s goal. If your line produces 30 items in the next hour, what number will be displayed on the status board?
Q. You are a teller at a bank. A customer has $252 in their checking account. They write a check for $287 (debit) that is cashed by the recipient. Will the new balance be positive or negative?
Q. Yesterday, it was negative 7 degrees Fahrenheit outside. Today, it is 14 degrees Fahrenheit warmer. Click on today's temperature.

Q. You are calculating altitude for different geographic zones. Mt. Everest is 29,035 feet above sea level. The Dead Sea is 1,388 feet below sea level. If you were to descend down from the highest peak of Mt. Everest to the very base of the Dead Sea, how many vertical feet would you travel? _____ ft
Q. You are overseeing a machine that seals 80 soda cans per minute. In one hour of time, how many soda cans will be sealed? _____ soda cans
answer_content: Solution: The correct answer is 4,800 soda cans.

question_content: Q. At a city water purification plant, water is mixed with a release agent in a ratio of 8:1. You are using 32 ounces of water. How many ounces of the release agent should you mix with the water? _____ ounces of release agent
Q. The telephone company purchased 95 yards of wire for $1,235 in September. They plan on making a purchase of 285 yards in October. How much will the October purchase cost?
If you have a job that earns $160 in 2 days, how much will you earn in 7 days? $_____
Q. The blueprint of a conference room is made using a scale of 2 centimeters to 1 meter. If the drawing shows the room is 12 centimeters long, how long is the actual room?

Q. A catering service is serving a party with 75 guests. The recipe for cornbread calls for 9 cups of flour and will serve 15 people. How much flour will be needed to serve cornbread to the 75 guests? _____ cups of flour
Q. You’re making deliveries and can travel 324 miles on 18 gallons of gas. How far can you travel on 41 gallons of gas?

Q. You’re working as a floor rep in the local home improvement store. The store wants to increase its inventory. Last year, 40 lawn mowers cost $4,776. At the same cost, how much will 120 lawn mowers cost this year?
Q. Last week you worked 40 hours. This week, you worked 6 fewer hours than last week. How many hours did you work this week? _____ hours
Q. A soda at the store where you work costs 75¢. A customer hands you this change to pay for it. How much does he still owe you?

Q. After mulching several yards of plant beds, you realize you only used 18 bags out of the 23 you purchased. Because you want to be reimbursed for all unused bags, how many bags will you return to get your money back?

Q. You’re recording inventory after a big weekend sale in the travel section of a department store. There are 20 remaining suitcases, of which 16 will be further marked down. True or False: The fraction 20 16 is in the simplest form.
Q. To find out how much raw material will be removed from a product your company manufactures, find the common denominator needed to subtract the following fractions. The common denominator is _____

Q. You are working in a coffee shop that specializes in mixing rare beans to provide customers with the perfect cup of coffee. To make the Signature Blend, you need to fill the coffee machine with 1 3 4 cups of Bean A and 3 1 2 cups of Bean B. How many cups of coffee beans are required for the Signature Blend?

  1. 4 1 4 cups
  2. 5 1 4 cups
  3. 5 3 4 cups

Q. The accounting office needs you to complete your time sheet so they can process payroll. You worked 6 1 4 hours on Project A, 11 1 2 hours on Project B and 13 3 4 hours on Project C. Convert the fractions to decimals and add to determine the total amount of time spent on projects. _____ Hours

Q. A metal alloy is made by mixing 1 2 ounce of metal C with 1 3 ounce of metal D. What is the total weight of the alloy?

  1. 1 6 of an ounce
  2. 1 5 of an ounce
  3. 1 2 of an ounce
  4. 5 6 of an ounce

Q. At a residential construction site, a piece of crown molding is 64 1 4 inches long. If you cut 30 7 8 inches off, how much crown molding is left?

  1. 25 3 8 inches
  2. 35 inches
  3. 30 1 8 inches
  4. 33 3 8 inches
Q. A customer orders a $3.50 slice of pizza, and pays you with a dollar and 9 quarters. Did the customer pay you the right amount?

choice.a: No, the customer paid more than $3.50.

choice.b: No, the customer paid less than $3.50.

question_content: Q. For your job you need to track the amount of time you spend on each project and your total time. For Project A, you spend 1 hour and 25 minutes. For Project B, you spend 45 minutes. How many total minutes did you spend on the two projects combined?

Q. You've been given a twenty-dollar bill that you need to break into smaller bills and coins in order to make change. You break it into three (3) five-dollar bills, and three (3) one-dollar bills. How many quarters do you need to complete the conversion?
Q. At the bakery where you work, dough for a certain type of pastry needs to be chilled for an hour and a half. Your timer only shows time in minutes. How many minutes should you chill the dough?

Q. A board that measures 3 4 feet long is cut into 6 equal pieces. What is the length of each piece?

  1. 1 1 2 inches
  2. 3 1 2 inches
  3. 3 inches
  4. 9 inches

Q. A seamstress is covering a banner with fabric. She has a piece of fabric that is 2 yards long and 36 inches wide. What size banner can she cover with the fabric? Multiply the length and width to find the answer.
Q. A trucker had a load of grain containing 2 tons. She unloaded 1 ton and 1,200 pounds at the warehouse. How much grain does she still have left on the truck?
Q. On a recent business trip, it took 7 hours 30 minutes to drive 375 miles. How many miles per hour was the average?
Q. You are employed at a grain processing plant that sells cornmeal for $1.28 per pound. If a sack of cornmeal weighs 4 pounds 12 ounces, how much does it cost?
Q. A mechanic has a radiator hose that measures 32 feet long. It needs to be cut into pieces equaling 5 feet 3 inches. How many whole pieces can it be cut into?
Q. A pharmacist mixes 3 grams of compound with 5,000 milligrams of solution to create a prescription. How many total grams is the prescription?

You work in a grocery store warehouse recording shipments. A driver delivers 25 crates of strawberries for distribution. A store calls needing seven crates of strawberries. After you fill this order, how many crates of strawberries are available for other stores?

You work in a restaurant, and a family comes in for dinner. You and your coworker wait on the table and prepare their food. The family gives you an $11 tip. You want to split the tip evenly with your coworker. How much should you give your coworker?

You work in a hospital, and instructions for an instrument state that it should be cleaned in the sterilizer for two hours. The sterilizer requires cleaning time be entered in minutes. How many minutes do you set for the sterilizer?
You work on a line where a finished product is selected every 12 minutes for inspection. At that rate, how many products are selected every hour?

You track inventory at a furniture store. On Monday morning, the delivery truck delivered 15 new mattresses to an empty warehouse. After the delivery, your team sold 7 mattresses on Monday, 2 mattresses on Tuesday, 0 on Wednesday, and 5 on Thursday. On Friday morning, you received a new order of 15 mattresses. How many mattresses do you have available for sale after the delivery on Friday morning?

You supervise a team of seven workers. You record the number of team members who reached their production goal each day. For the past week, you record the following data: Monday, 5 team members reached their goal; Tuesday, 4 team members reached their goal; Wednesday, 2 team members reached their goal; Thursday, 7 team members reach their goal; Friday, 3 team members reached their goal. What was the average number of team members who reached their goal per day?

You work for a lawn service and need to prepare fertilizer for the day. The directions state that you should mix four ounces of fertilizer for every ten gallons of water. The tank holds 50 gallons of water. You want to have a full tank to start the day’s work. How many ounces of fertilizer should you add to the tank?
You work with a carpenter who asks you to cut 4 boards to the following lengths: 7½ inches, 10½ inches, 9 inches, and 5½ inches. What is the total length, in inches, of the cut boards?
A grocer reports that the store has sold 72 of the 90 boxes of apples delivered this week. What percentage of the delivered apples have been sold?

A customer decides to build a fence around the backyard shown. The fence will not have any gates. The yard is rectangular, with the house being an equal distance from both property lines. As a result, the fence will have five sections. The short sections, connecting to the house, are each 10 feet in length. The yard has a length of 80 feet and a width of 65 feet. How many feet of fencing is needed?
You measure containers for international shipments. The height of the standard container is 6 feet and 7 inches. Which of the following is closest to its height in meters?

You operate a fresh fruit and vegetable market. For normal shipments, about 9.0% of the peaches are spoiled when they reach your market. You anticipate a busy weekend and would like to have 100 pounds of peaches to sell. To have 100 pounds of peaches and considering the spoilage rate, how many pounds should you order?

You work as an assistant to a carpenter who designed the tabletop below. He tells you that each shape is a right triangle, and each is the same size. You now need to calculate the area of one triangle so that you can begin building the tabletop. What is the area of each triangle in square inches?

You work on a concrete crew starting a construction project. Once the pouring begins, it must continue nonstop until it is completed. The total project requires 175,000 yards of concrete. Your supervisor estimates that around 1,200 yards can be poured per hour. How many consecutive days of work should be planned for this project?

You need to purchase supplies for building a backyard deck. Your boss gives you the supply list and asks that you get the best deal by buying from either True Builder or Quality Supplies. You call both stores, and they provide the price information that you put into the table below. Which store provides the lowest total cost, and what is the cost without sales tax?

Product True Builder Prices Quality Supplies Prices
Bricks $55 for flat of 25 bricks $2.25 per brick
2 x 4 boards $0.75 per foot $7.00 for 10 feet
1 x 6 boards $0.60 per foot $6.50 for 10 feet
2 x 6 boards $0.80 per foot $8.00 for 10 feet
Paint $15.50 per gallon $22.50 for 2 gallons
Paint Brushes $7.50 each $9.75 each
Supplies Quantity
Bricks 120
2 x 4 boards 40 feet
1 x 6 boards 120 feet
2 x 6 boards 30 feet
Paint 2 gallons
Paint Brushes 2 brushes

You are designing a 5-kilometer course for a local charity run. Your assistants provide you with the following measures in yards. You need to tell your assistants how much further they need to extend the finish line to complete the course. By how many more yards does the course need to be extended?

Course Streets Distance in yards
Main Street to 6th Ave. 781
6th Ave. to Pleasant Road 1,250
Pleasant Road to City Park 275
Route through City Park 2,337
City Park to Main Street 725
